awd_titl_txt: STTR Phase I:  Edge-Based Oil Condition Monitoring System for Heavy Equipment
awd_abstract_narration:
This Small Business Technology Transfer (STTR) Phase I project will develop an intelligent onsite oil condition monitoring system to quickly analyze the health of high-speed rotating and reciprocating machinery.  Oil condition monitoring is a new and high-growth market with revenues of $505 million in 2017 and expected growth to $850 million by 2023. The market for onsite oil monitoring is expected to increase from $193 million to $332 million during the same time frame. This project develops a benchtop oil monitoring minimum viable system for the transportation and heavy equipment industry. The system offers not only the current health status of a machine but also prognosis of wear trends and life cycle. The system informs a prescriptive and optimized maintenance strategy for each piece of machinery, extending its life and reliability and preventing catastrophic machine failures. It will lead to significant cost, energy, and time savings with sustainability benefits.
 
The intellectual merit of this project develops a disruptive onsite oil condition system based on wear debris sensing arrays and artificial intelligence-based oil property sensing technology. The major innovations include: 1) a unique inductive pulse sensing array that can detect fine wear debris, 2) microfluidic signal multiplexing technologies to detect fine wear debris, 3) unique big data analysis and signal multiplexing that allow fast data processing to obtain real time health status, and 4) a novel artificial intelligence technique, namely a General Regression Neural Network (GRNN) approach that allows acquiring robust, reliable measurements of many properties rapidly with sensors’ cross sensitivities, but significantly reduces the network’s training time. As a result, the sensing system provides comprehensive, real-time information about oil conditions and the machine health status.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
Zsense Systems has developed an oil condition monitor system aiming to detect early onset of severe wear or lubricant degradation, and predict remaining useful life of a machine by accurately detecting multiple important oil properties. The first application for this technology is to provide heath information to the managers of heavy machines. The Zsense Oil Monitor is expected to enable a 20% reduction in maintenance cost.

Zsense’ minimum viable product (MVP) will be capable of providing accurate measurements of multiple important oil properties (e.g. size and counts of wear debris, viscosity, concentrations of moisture, acid, base), via which the health status and remaining life of a machine can be evaluated; machine owners/managers can thus schedule optimal maintenance intervals and avoid sudden machine shutdown.

Under the Phase I STTR, Zsense made significant progress toward the development of its MVP Oil Monitor, including:

  • Producing an MVP oil debris sensor array based on a novel big data processing method, which can detect 20µm one by one with significantly reduced data set;
  • Producing an MVP oil property sensor array based on proprietary algorithmic processing, which can accurately determine multiple oil properties from overlapped sensor responses;
  • Developing a firmware and software specifically designed for use with the Oil Monitor system
  • Demonstrating the Zsense Oil Monitor prototype with industrial partner to prove that it generates accurate data to judge a machine’s health status 

Along with technical advancements, Zsense has continued customer discovery in our target market. Our continued work has resulted in many industry partnerships in the oil, gas and renewable energy industries. Future commercial interest and development includes pilot studies for stationary and mobile applications.

In general Zsense has achieved a major breakthrough in creating an integrated lubricant oil wear debris and property monitoring system that can monitor early abnormal wear and provide accurate key important information in avoiding sudden machine shutdown and determining optimal machine maintenance.  While the results are promising, this product remains in an early prototype stage. Zsense will focus on bringing the MVP Zsense Oil Monitor to market via Phase II.

 

 


Last Modified: 01/11/2024
Modified by: Joe James
